snippet: Four side-by-side lockers in one corner of the Giants’ locker room have emerged as a distinct power corridor, a kind of leadership command center for a team with more than 20 new players.
abstract: Four side-by-side lockers in corner of New York Giants’ locker room have emerged as a distinct power corridor, a kind of leadership command center for a team with more than 20 new players; quarterback Eli Manning, running back Rashad Jennings, middle linebacker Jon Beason and strong safety Antrel Rolle, are using proximity of their lockers to commune not only about game plans but also ways to motivate and guide teammates.
lead_paragraph: Four side-by-side lockers in one corner of the Giants’ locker room have emerged as a distinct power corridor, a kind of leadership command center for a team with more than 20 new players.

headline.main: In the Giants’ Locker Room, Leadership Sits All in a Row
headline.print_headline: In the Giants’ Locker Room, Leadership Sits All in a Row
